ref: 12479 śiṣṭá2 ʻ taught ʼ AV., ʻ disciplined ʼ ŚBr., ʻ learned ʼ Mn., m. ʻ chief ʼ Hit. [√śās]
Pk. siṭṭha -- ʻ ordered, taught ʼ, m. ʻ gentleman ʼ;

lang: Language of `Kharoṣṭhī Inscriptions discovered by Sir Aurel Stein in Chinese Turkestan' edited by A. M. Boyer, E. J. Rapson, and E. Senart
ref: NiDoc. śiṭha ʻ punishment ʼ, śiṭhidavya ʻ to be punished ʼ;
Or. siṭha ʻ officer of a rājā's household in charge of palace and granary ʼ;
Si. siṭu ʻ nobleman ʼ, hiṭāno ʻ very wealthy man ʼ (ES 96 < śrēṣṭhin -- ).
